required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of a Patient-Specific Enteroatmospheric Fistula Isolation and Management Device Independent of Negative Pressure Wound Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of a Patient-Specific Enteroatmospheric Fistula Isolation and Management Device Independent of Negative Pressure Wound Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the efficacy of a custom fitted device designed to isolate enteroatmospheric fistulas effluent independent of negative pressure wound therapy and to evaluate the effects on the device related to dressing changes, time required for dressing changes, management costs, and the ease of use.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in inpatient participant pain rating
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate their pain on a scale of 1-10, where 10 indicates more pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in outpatient participant pain rating
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from discharge until fistula resolves or study ends, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate their pain on a scale of 1-10, where 10 indicates more pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in inpatient participant mobility assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Mobility will be assessed by asking the participant to select the following statement that most accurately describes their mobility: a. completely immobile; b. unable to sit up supported for less than 10 minutes; c. able to sit supported for more than 10 minutes; d. able to sit unsupported, can lift arms; e. can stand up and pivot torso; or f. can walk and move with minimal assistance required.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in outpatient participant mobility assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from until fistula resolves or study ends, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Mobility will be assessed by asking the participant to select the following statement that most accurately describes their mobility: a. completely immobile; b. unable to sit up supported for less than 10 minutes; c. able to sit supported for more than 10 minutes; d. able to sit unsupported, can lift arms; e. can stand up and pivot torso; or f. Can walk and move with minimal assistance required.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of required wound dressing changes - inpatient
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The number of dressing changes will be tracked for inpatients on a daily bases.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of required wound dressing changes - outpatient
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from discharge until fistula resolves or study ends, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The number of dressing changes will be tracked for outpatients on a daily bases.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Inpatient participants will be asked three questions about the perceived usefulness of the device. The questions use a 5-point Likert scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree, where strongly agree indicates a higher perceived usefulness.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from discharge until fistula resolves or study ends, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Outpatient participants will be asked two questions about the perceived usefulness of the device. The questions use a 5-point Likert scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree, where strongly agree indicates a higher perceived usefulness.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived ease of use - inpatient
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Inpatient participants will be asked four questions about the perceived ease of use of the device. The question uses a 5 point Likert scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree, where strongly agree indicates a higher perceived ease of use.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived ease of use - outpatient
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from discharge until fistula resolves or study ends, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Inpatient participants will be asked four questions about the perceived ease of use of the device. The question uses a 5 point Likert scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree, where strongly agree indicates a higher perceived ease of use.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in average time of required fistula-specific dressing changes - inpatient
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from admission to discharge, up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The time required to change the wound dressings will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through duration of study, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The number of infections in participants that are related to the device will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through duration of study, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The number of observed leakages in participants that are related to the device will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through duration of study, up to 1 year
Through duration of study, up to 1 year
Through duration of study, up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The number of complication occurrences related to the device will be recorded.

other_outcome.measure: Cost analysis of the 3D printed device
other_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from beginning of study until the end of the study, up to 1 year
other_outcome.description: The cost of the patient management with the device will be estimated

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a custom fitted device designed to isolate EAF effluent independent of negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) utilizing 3D printing technology to design a participant-matched device that more easily and effectively separates the participant's fistula and any emanated intestinal contents surrounding the wound.

intervention.description: Participants will receive a customized 3D printed device based on the EAF's output, size, shape, location, depth, and the participant's wound bed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stable condition, as determined by attending physician
- Has enteroatmospheric fistula (EAF) in the setting of open abdomen
- EAF is determined to require surgical resolution
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable condition, as determined by attending physician
- Significant risk of complication
